                    -->'''{name3}:''' Whoa! ({name}), you're the best!<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Hmmm, I wonder what kind of mask will fit you best? How about... a slime mask?<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Yay, Paimon Slime!

|vo_01_11_title      = About [[Yoimiya]]
|vo_01_11_quest      = Dreamlike Timelessness
|vo_01_11_file_male  = VO_{language}{character1}_About Yoimiya.ogg
|vo_01_11_file_female= VO_{language}{character2}_About Yoimiya.ogg
|vo_01_11_tx         = '''{name3}:''' Do you think [[Naganohara Ryuunosuke|Yoimiya's dad]]'s poor hearing is related to fireworks?<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' He's been making and testing fireworks for many years now, and being exposed to the sound of gunpowder explosions on a daily basis... Paimon can see how that might've worn down his ears...<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Yikes! Since Yoimiya is inheriting her family business, does that mean she'll have trouble hearing other people in the future, just like her dad?<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Paimon won't let that happen! Let's think of some way to help her!<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Do you have any suggestions, Paimon?<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Uh... Um...<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Paimon could follow Yoimiya around and cover her ears whenever needed...<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Then you'd need to leave me.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' ...Without Paimon, you'd lose your guide. Paimon wouldn't leave you like that!<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' But... What should we do for Yoimiya...<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Actually, she can simply wear earplugs while working with fireworks.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Oh yeah! Paimon didn't think of that solution! You're so smart!<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Heh... That was the first thing that came to my mind, but I wanted to give you an opportunity for a mental workout.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Eh? So you knew this whole time, but didn't tell Paimon?<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' How could you! You bully!
|vo_01_11_mention    = Naganohara Ryuunosuke,Yoimiya

|vo_01_12_title      = About [[Sayu]]'s Troubles
|vo_01_12_waypoint   = in [[Inazuma City]], [[Inazuma]]
|vo_01_12_file_male  = VO_{language}{character1}_About Sayu's Troubles.ogg
|vo_01_12_file_female= VO_{language}{character2}_About Sayu's Troubles.ogg
|vo_01_12_tx         = '''{name3}:''' Sayu seems to have a lot on her mind.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Paimon can't understand why she'd have so many worries.<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' I guess this is what they call growing pains.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Hmm, Paimon can't relate to that.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' After all, it's not Paimonly to worry too much.<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Hmmm...<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Bad news! We're almost out of Mora. I guess we'll have to tighten the purse strings for the next few days...<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Wh-What? Noooo!<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' See, you're not as carefree as you thought.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' How could you prank Paimon like that...
|vo_01_12_mention    = Sayu

|vo_01_13_title      = About [[Onikabuto]]
|vo_01_13_waypoint   = in [[Inazuma City]], [[Inazuma]]
|vo_01_13_file_male  = VO_{language}{character1}_About Onikabuto.ogg
|vo_01_13_file_female= VO_{language}{character2}_About Onikabuto.ogg
|vo_01_13_tx         = '''{name3}:''' Those Onikabuto bugs look so scary! The patterns on their backs are terrifying!<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Do you mean those demonic patterns? It's because they don't like to fight, so they purposely evolved their patterns in a way that scares their enemies away.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' That's really smart. We should try to learn a thing or two from them!<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' We could borrow [[Xiao]]'s mask. If a hilichurl saw you wearing it, do you think they'd run in fear?<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Uh... I don't think Xiao would agree to that...<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Yeah... Hmm, how about we ask Sayu to steal his mask for us?<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' She knows ninjutsu that allows her to vanish into thin air. She can steal it for sure! Problem solved!<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Uh... If we are afraid of Xiao evening the score with us, how about we steal [[Childe]]'s mask? We've kicked his butt many times before!<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' I don't think stealing other people's belongings is a good idea. Also, what if Sayu doesn't agree to all of this?<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Th&mdash;Then let's... Let's visit [[Albedo]] first.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' If Albedo can develop a growth serum for Sayu, she'll help us for sure!<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Brilliant, now we just need you to come up with a way to make Albedo help us.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Ugh! Paimon's head is going to explode. Let's stick to festival masks for now.
|vo_01_13_mention    = Xiao,Sayu,Tartaglia,Albedo

|vo_01_14_title      = About [[Naku Weed]]
|vo_01_14_statue     = ({{Electro}}) in [[Tatarasuna]], [[Inazuma]]
|vo_01_14_file_male  = VO_{language}{character1}_About Naku Weed.ogg
|vo_01_14_file_female= VO_{language}{character2}_About Naku Weed.ogg
|vo_01_14_tx         = '''{name3}:''' Even though Naku Weed has a flower-like structure, its "petals" are in fact leaves.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Its actual bloom is rather fragile, so the surrounding leaves try their hardest to grow strong and protect it...<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Hee-hee, just like Paimon is protecting you right now.<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Just like you? Oh, is Naku Weed edible too?<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Yeah, that's right! ...Wait? What are you trying to say?

|vo_01_15_title      = About Naku Weed and Storms
|vo_01_15_statue     = ({{Electro}}) in [[Tatarasuna]], [[Inazuma]]
|vo_01_15_file_male  = VO_{language}{character1}_About Naku Weed and Storms.ogg
|vo_01_15_file_female= VO_{language}{character2}_About Naku Weed and Storms.ogg
|vo_01_15_tx         = '''{name3}:''' Did you know? The people in Inazuma use the vibrations of Naku Weed to forecast thunderstorms.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Because the Naku Weed grows in areas that are infused with Electro, it's naturally drawn to thunder and lightning.<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Does that mean Naku Weed is similar to you, Paimon?<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Eh? How so?<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' You know, because you usually hang out in areas infused with gourmet food and are naturally drawn to tasty snacks!<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Hee-hee, that's true!<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Paimon radar activated...<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' *beep* Delicacies, here we go!

|vo_01_16_title      = About [[Sakura Bloom]]s
|vo_01_16_waypoint   = in [[Grand Narukami Shrine]], [[Inazuma]]
|vo_01_16_file_male  = VO_{language}{character1}_About Sakura Blooms.ogg
|vo_01_16_file_female= VO_{language}{character2}_About Sakura Blooms.ogg
|vo_01_16_tx         = '''{name3}:''' The blossoms drifting down from the [[Sacred Sakura]] are so dazzling!<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Paimon heard that those flower petals can stay suspended in the air for so long because of being infused with Electro.<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Is it the same principle behind your levitation abilities?<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Uh... Ah...That's because...<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' You do know what allows you to fly, don't you, Paimon?<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Paimon can fly because of... mysterious powers, obviously!<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Got it. Seems like you have no idea.<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' How about we let Albedo do some research? He's good at cracking such mysteries...<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Please don't!
|vo_01_16_mention    = Albedo

|vo_01_17_title      = About [[Lavender Melon]]s
|vo_01_17_waypoint   = in [[Konda Village]], [[Inazuma]]
|vo_01_17_file_male  = VO_{language}{character1}_About Lavender Melons.ogg
|vo_01_17_file_female= VO_{language}{character2}_About Lavender Melons.ogg
|vo_01_17_tx         = '''{name3}:''' Lavender Melons sure are useful!<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Their flesh can be eaten, and their skin can be processed to make dyes.<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Paimon sure is useful!<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' She can serve as my guide, and she can also give other people ugly nicknames, haha.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Yep! Thank you for your validation!<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Wait a minute, is there more? Is Paimon about to get roasted?<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Paimon's gonna cover your mouth to stop you from talking!

|vo_01_18_title      = About Swords
|vo_01_18_waypoint   = in [[Inazuma City]], [[Inazuma]]
|vo_01_18_file_male  = VO_{language}{character1}_About Swords.ogg
|vo_01_18_file_female= VO_{language}{character2}_About Swords.ogg
|vo_01_18_tx         = '''{name3}:''' ({name}), have you noticed?<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' In Inazuma, people who wear swords on their waists are a minority. Most soldiers use spears.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Could it be that swords are a symbol of status... Should we wear them as well?<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' But the swords here are all too big for Paimon... There's no other way, we'll have to find a famous swordsmith to make a custom one!<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' A custom-made sword will cost a lot of Mora though.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Are you saying that Mora is more important than the desires of your lovely companion?<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' ...Actually, I've already prepared something for you, Paimon.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Really? Really? Let's have a look!<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Hey! Isn't that the knife we use to cut fruit?<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Well, at least it's the right size for you...<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Ahem, "What matters isn't the value of the sword, it's the fighting spirit."<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Nice try, but Paimon won't fall for this, no matter how cool it sounds!

|vo_01_19_title      = About Hot Springs
|vo_01_19_waypoint   = in [[Inazuma City]], [[Inazuma]]
|vo_01_19_file_male  = VO_{language}{character1}_About Hot Springs.ogg
|vo_01_19_file_female= VO_{language}{character2}_About Hot Springs.ogg
|vo_01_19_tx         = '''{name3}:''' Did you know there are hot springs in Inazuma?<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' ...But there are no volcanoes.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Umm, Paimon heard that the heat comes from a giant furnace!<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' If we get the chance, Paimon also wants to check out a hot spring. Unfortunately, it seems like only the big shots are granted entry.<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Hmmm...<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Let's head back to the Dadaupa Gorge in Mondstadt!<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Eh? Why so sudden?<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Back in the Dadaupa Gorge, the hilichurls have a huge cauldron that's heated by Flaming Flowers. It should be similar to a hot spring, right? You can bathe in their... soup, I guess?<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' ???

|vo_01_20_title      = About {{w|Jugemu}}
|vo_01_20_waypoint   = in [[Inazuma City]], [[Inazuma]]
|vo_01_20_file_male  = VO_{language}{character1}_About Jugemu.ogg
|vo_01_20_file_female= VO_{language}{character2}_About Jugemu.ogg
|vo_01_20_tx         = '''{name3}:''' In Inazuma, it's customary for parents to choose a lucky name for their child.<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Those names symbolize everyone's expectations and wishes for the child, like prosperity, wealth, good health, and safety.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Because of these expectations, parents often pick extra long names, and cram all sorts of blessings into them.<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' So hypothetically, if one day a little girl fell into a lake on her way back home, then her friends might rush to her house to tell everyone, "Something bad happened!"<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' "Oh, what happened?"<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Ozvaldo Hrafnavins, Prinzessin der Verurteilung Fischl von Luftschloss Narfidort, come quick! Centennial Genius Astrologist [[Mona]] Megistus has fallen into the water!<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' ...Mona falling into the water doesn't sound like an emergency situation though.<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Precisely. The fast-swimming Mona would come back home around the same time her friends are done saying her name, haha.
|vo_01_20_mention    = Oz,Fischl,Mona

|vo_01_21_title      = About [[Inazuma|Inazuma's Islands]]
|vo_01_21_waypoint   = in [[Ritou]], [[Inazuma]]
|vo_01_21_file_male  = VO_{language}{character1}_About Inazuma's Islands.ogg
|vo_01_21_file_female= VO_{language}{character2}_About Inazuma's Islands.ogg
|vo_01_21_tx         = '''{name3}:''' Inazuma's scenery is quite different than what we've seen so far.<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Yeah, Inazuma's an island nation.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Before the invention of boats, how did the people living on different islands communicate with one another?<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' According to Yoimiya's dad, they probably used smoke signals to transmit information.<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Or, they would...<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Yeah...?<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' They would commission people who could freeze the water surface to travel between the islands and deliver messages.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Whoa! If Kaeya had lived in Inazuma back then, he would've been even busier than Master Jean now!
|vo_01_21_mention    = Naganohara Ryuunosuke,Kaeya,Jean

|vo_01_22_title      = About [[Bake-Danuki|Tanuki]]
|vo_01_22_waypoint   = in [[Chinju Forest]], [[Inazuma]]
|vo_01_22_file_male  = VO_{language}{character1}_About Tanuki.ogg
|vo_01_22_file_female= VO_{language}{character2}_About Tanuki.ogg
|vo_01_22_tx         = '''{name3}:''' Tanuki are really mysterious creatures.<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' I think they are really cute.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Yeah, they're cute... until they start talking.<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Hmm, I wonder... If you couldn't talk, would you appear to be more mysterious and noble?<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Are you trying to mock me?<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' *randomly humming innocently*

|vo_01_23_title      = About Tanuki and Their Illusions
|vo_01_23_waypoint   = in [[Chinju Forest]], [[Inazuma]]
|vo_01_23_file_male  = VO_{language}{character1}_About Tanuki and Their Illusions.ogg
|vo_01_23_file_female= VO_{language}{character2}_About Tanuki and Their Illusions.ogg
|vo_01_23_tx         = '''{name3}:''' Did anyone tell you that there are monsters called tanuki in Inazuma that can take on the form of any human they see?<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' I heard such rumors before. They must know some mysterious transformation techniques.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' What if one day a tanuki tricked you by transforming into Paimon? Oh no... Paimon's worried now!<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' No worries, I'd surely be able to tell the difference&mdash; Wait! You're just concerned about my Mora, aren't you?<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Of course... Ah! ...No, no! Paimon's only concerned about your safety, ({name})!<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Hmph, stop looking at Paimon like that. *pouting* Look, just think about it! If there were two Paimons, how would you find out which one is the real one?<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' ...Eh-he.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' What do you mean "eh-he"!?<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' See, only the real Paimon would respond like that.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Ah! Paimon got tricked again...

|vo_01_24_title      = About Other Shrines
|vo_01_24_waypoint   = in [[Araumi]], [[Inazuma]]
|vo_01_24_file_male  = VO_{language}{character1}_About Other Shrines.ogg
|vo_01_24_file_female= VO_{language}{character2}_About Other Shrines.ogg
|vo_01_24_tx         = '''{name3}:''' We've been passing by a lot of small shrines lately, but none of them seem to be dedicated to the Electro Archon.<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' They were probably built for lesser deities. The people of Inazuma believe that everything around them has a spirit, and those spirits will help them in their time of need.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Oh, so the people make shrines for them, and give them offerings.<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Yeah. In a way, it's a form of prayer and a token of appreciation.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Paimon gets it now! Let's find Ayaka, and have her put up a shrine for us!<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' If we do that, we'll be able to get lots of offerings as well!<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Paimon's so happy!<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Hehe. Uh... I&mdash;Is that an acceptable thing to do?<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' What's wrong? Haven't we been helping out everyone this whole time? We may be doing an even better job than those deities!<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' You do have a point...<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' But when I picture people placing flowers or fruits in front of a shrine for me... it doesn't feel right.
|vo_01_24_mention    = Kamisato Ayaka

|vo_01_25_title      = About the Rain on [[Yashiori Island]]
|vo_01_25_waypoint   = in [[Nazuchi Beach]], [[Inazuma]]
|vo_01_25_file_male  = VO_{language}{character1}_About the Rain on Yashiori Island.ogg
|vo_01_25_file_female= VO_{language}{character2}_About the Rain on Yashiori Island.ogg
|vo_01_25_tx         = '''({name}):''' It never stops raining on Yashiori Island. I heard it's because of the [[Tatarigami|lingering evil energy]].<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' "Evil energy"? What's that? Sounds terrifying.<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' It's caused by the remains of an [[Orobashi|evil god]] somewhere on the island. Because its power hasn't fully dispersed, the remaining energy causes all sorts of misfortunes. That's what I meant when I said "evil energy."<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Oh, that makes sense. But Paimon doesn't think rain is a bad thing.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Maybe that god has been crying all this time because they were bullied.<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Crying? I don't think gods can cry. I mean, I've never seen Venti or [[Zhongli]] cry before.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' There are exceptions! If you pinch Paimon, you'll be able to see a crying god.<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Hmm? Are you a god?<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Paimon sure is!<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Okay, let me guess... The flying god of silly questions? The god of slimes? Or the god of being fished out from the water?<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Paimon's none of those! Hmph!<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' As your bodyguard, ({name}), Paimon is the god of protection! Hehe.
|vo_01_25_mention    = Venti,Zhongli

|vo_01_26_title      = About [[Bantan Sango Detective Agency]]
|vo_01_26_waypoint   = in [[Inazuma City]], [[Inazuma]]
|vo_01_26_file_male  = VO_{language}{character1}_About Bantan Sango Detective Agency.ogg
|vo_01_26_file_female= VO_{language}{character2}_About Bantan Sango Detective Agency.ogg
|vo_01_26_tx         = '''({name}):''' In Hanamizaka, there's a place called the Bantan Sango Detective Agency.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Paimon remembers. It's the one run by [[Sango]] and [[Ryuuji]], right? Everyone speaks highly of them.<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Uh, I heard that they frequently get caught up in strange incidents, and some places have banned them from entering their premises...<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Paimon thinks that's undeserved. After all, Sango and Ryuuji have helped a lot of people...<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Would you invite them if you were organizing a dinner party?<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' What if halfway through the meal, one of the guests suddenly shrieked and collapsed onto the ground...<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' I&mdash;If that's the case, then Paimon thinks it's a bad idea. Paimon suddenly feels that hanging out with them could be dangerous...<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Well, that's the price you pay for being a famous detective.
|vo_01_26_mention    = Sango,Ryuuji

|vo_01_27_title      = About Drawing [[Fortune Slip]]s
|vo_01_27_waypoint   = in [[Inazuma City]], [[Inazuma]]
|vo_01_27_file_male  = VO_{language}{character1}_About Drawing Fortune Slips.ogg
|vo_01_27_file_female= VO_{language}{character2}_About Drawing Fortune Slips.ogg
|vo_01_27_tx         = '''{name3}:''' Oh yeah, have you drawn fortune slips at the shrine before, ({name})?<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' If we draw them before our next adventure, they may provide us with some guidance.<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Hmm, but what if our draws are inauspicious or turn out to be a bad omen? If that happened, we'd probably end up in a bad mood...<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' That's fine. According to the shrine maidens, if someone draws a bad omen, then they just need to hang it on a tree in the shrine...<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' So, we should keep on drawing and drawing, until we get a super lucky draw! We'll hang all the bad ones on the tree!<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' If everyone did that, there'd be no more space left to hang the slips...

|vo_01_28_title      = About [[Musou no Hitotachi]]
|vo_01_28_quest      = Omnipresence Over Mortals
|vo_01_28_file_male  = VO_{language}{character1}_About Musou no Hitotachi.ogg
|vo_01_28_file_female= VO_{language}{character2}_About Musou no Hitotachi.ogg
|vo_01_28_tx         = '''{name3}:''' Musou no Hitotachi is amazing!<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' It can beat any enemy with a single slash!<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Uh, but for Childe, it might need three slashes...<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Y&mdash;Yeah!<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Anyway, if you mastered that technique, Paimon wouldn't have to worry about you for the rest of our journey!<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' So, where can one learn that technique?<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Yeah, where can one learn that technique?<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Hm<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Quit looking at Paimon like that! O&mdash;Okay, Paimon will keep an eye on you during our adventures...
|vo_01_28_mention    = Tartaglia

|vo_01_29_title      = About [[Sangonomiya Kokomi]]
|vo_01_29_quest      = Omnipresence Over Mortals
|vo_01_29_file_male  = VO_{language}{character1}_About Sangonomiya Kokomi.ogg
|vo_01_29_file_female= VO_{language}{character2}_About Sangonomiya Kokomi.ogg
|vo_01_29_tx         = '''{name3}:''' Did you know, ({name})? That Sangonomiya Kokomi, she's [[Watatsumi Island]]'s Divine Priestess.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' In other words, she's the ruler of Watatsumi Island! The whole of Watatsumi Island is controlled by her.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Paimon also wants to become a big shot like her...<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' What will you do after you become a big shot?<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Then, Paimon will deliver justice. For example... Ahem.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' The suspect in question, known as the Traveler, ate two [[Tricolor Dango|Dango]] for lunch and only gave one to the victim, Paimon. This is a serious violation of article thirty seven, "Fairness and Justice," of the "Paimon Decree."<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Oh... may I ask how Your Excellency Paimon plans to resolve this issue?<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Of course. As compensation for your wrongdoings, you will have to make even more Dango for Paimon, hee-hee!
|vo_01_29_mention    = Sangonomiya Kokomi

|vo_01_30_title      = About Transience
|vo_01_30_quest      = Omnipresence Over Mortals
|vo_01_30_file_male  = VO_{language}{character1}_About Transience.ogg
|vo_01_30_file_female= VO_{language}{character2}_About Transience.ogg
|vo_01_30_tx         = '''{name3}:''' Paimon wonders what the [[Makoto|previous Shogun]] was like.<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' It appears that she was a person who understood the fleeting nature of things, and accepted the inevitable fate of departing this world one day.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' After all, realizing the fragility of things in front of you makes you treasure them even more.<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' This way of thinking must've influenced Inazuma's aesthetics. This world is transient, people come and go. The fun times we shared, our companionship, and the delicious foods we got to savor &mdash; those emotions and experiences are real things that existed at some point in time, not just empty concepts.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Even though... Even though every banquet must eventually come to an end, it'd be nice to enjoy those happy moments for a little longer.<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' "Shifting seasons and elusive dreams, the ephemeral and fleeting, with thine companionship, all are eternal."<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Paimon doesn't get it!<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' I'm saying that I'm having a lot of fun traveling with you, Paimon. I'd be nice if we could just go on like this forever.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Paimon'll take your word for it then.
|vo_01_30_mention    = Makoto

|vo_01_31_title      = About Shrine Maidens
|vo_01_31_quest      = Omnipresence Over Mortals
|vo_01_31_file_male  = VO_{language}{character1}_About Shrine Maidens.ogg
|vo_01_31_file_female= VO_{language}{character2}_About Shrine Maidens.ogg
|vo_01_31_tx         = '''{name3}:''' The clothes that shrine maidens wear are quite unique.<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' I heard that after the Sakoku Decree is lifted, [[Yae Miko]] plans to run a rental service where people can try on shrine maiden outfits as a tourist attraction in various places. Combined with the latest Kamera technology from Fontaine, it seems like a real Mora maker.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Oh!<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' The shrine maidens in the Grand Shrine even asked me if I knew any pretty girls who are willing to become models. All they need to do is to dress up in a shrine maiden outfit and smile to the Kamera. They even asked me to be a model and said all I needed was some makeup.<ref group="Note">The audio differs for this line when playing as Lumine, but is not reflected in the transcript.</ref><br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' What!?<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' I immediately shared this idea with [[Rosaria]]. I feel like they can do something similar at the Church of Favonius with the garments they wear.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Wait, Paimon doesn't think that a...<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Sadly, Rosaria found the idea of it too troublesome.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Maybe it's for the better...<br /><!--
                    --><br /><!--
                    --><small>''(Actual voice-over for Lumine)''<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' The shrine maidens in the Grand Shrine even asked me '''if I was interested in becoming a model! All I need to do is wear a shrine maiden outfit and smile to the Kamera. They also asked me if I knew any other cute girls.'''</small>
|vo_01_31_mention    = Yae Miko,Rosaria

|vo_01_32_title      = About the Artist Utamarou
|vo_01_32_quest      = Omnipresence Over Mortals
|vo_01_32_file_male  = VO_{language}{character1}_About the Artist Utamarou.ogg
|vo_01_32_file_female= VO_{language}{character2}_About the Artist Utamarou.ogg
|vo_01_32_tx         = '''{name3}:''' [[Aoi]] gave Paimon a painting. Turns out it's not edible, but Paimon is still very happy with that gift!<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Aoi? The [[Tsukumomono Groceries|general goods shop]] owner? Let me see.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Here, but be careful. It was painted by a famous artist, Utamarou. It's quite valuable!<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Utamarou? Hmm... I think I've heard that name before...<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Of course, master Utamarou's works can be found all around Inazuma after all!<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Did you see one of them in Ayaka's residence? The one that Paimon has right now isn't too shabby either.<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Oh, I remember now! One of those paintings was used by Yoimiya as kindling, right?<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Eh? Kindling?<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Uh, yeah! I think Thoma used it as padding for table legs as well.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' What? Padding?<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' And, If I remember correctly, I also saw Sayu use a stack of those paintings as a cushion for her nap.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Sayu also has several of those works? That can't be right...<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Real masterpieces aren't mass-produced. If you ask me, that Utamarou isn't a real master at all.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Hey&mdash;
|vo_01_32_mention    = Aoi,Kamisato Ayaka,Yoimiya,Thoma,Sayu

|vo_01_33_title      = About the [[Komore Teahouse|Teahouse]] and [[Taroumaru|Its Owner]]
|vo_01_33_quest      = Omnipresence Over Mortals
|vo_01_33_file_male  = VO_{language}{character1}_About the Teahouse and Its Owner.ogg
|vo_01_33_file_female= VO_{language}{character2}_About the Teahouse and Its Owner.ogg
|vo_01_33_tx         = '''{name3}:''' The [[Komore Teahouse]] is doing surprisingly well. They have a great number of visitors every day.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' We should also open a teahouse. Paimon feels that it'd be really profitable!<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Hmm... Well, if we do end up opening a teahouse, then you're gonna be the boss, for sure.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Eh? Deal!<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Paimon didn't think that you'd have so much faith in Paimon's abilities... Paimon will make sure to be a responsible manager, and make our shop the best teahouse in Teyvat!<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Uhh, I don't think it'd need to be managed... Do you remember [[Taroumaru]]?<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Yup, it's the owner of the Komore Teahouse, right? A lot of the clients go to the Teahouse to play with him rather than drink tea.<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' So I was thinking, if you were running the shop, you'd definitely be more popular than Taroumaru.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Hee-hee, of course... Hey! So you don't really trust Paimon's management skills and just want a mascot!?
|vo_01_33_mention    = Taroumaru

|vo_01_34_title      = About the [[Sakoku Decree]]
|vo_01_34_quest      = Omnipresence Over Mortals
|vo_01_34_file_male  = VO_{language}{character1}_About the Sakoku Decree.ogg
|vo_01_34_file_female= VO_{language}{character2}_About the Sakoku Decree.ogg
|vo_01_34_tx         = '''({name}):''' With the abolishment of the Vision Hunt Decree, I guess the Sakoku Decree will be the next one to go.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Here's hoping that everything goes well.<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Let's encourage everyone to hold on for just bit longer.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Yeah!<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' If we get the chance, let's find [[Atsuko]] and tell her that the sakura trees in her homeland are blooming.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' How is that supposed to comfort her!?
|vo_01_34_mention    = Atsuko

|vo_01_35_title      = About Kimonos
|vo_01_35_quest      = Transient Dreams
|vo_01_35_file_male  = VO_{language}{character1}_About Kimonos.ogg
|vo_01_35_file_female= VO_{language}{character2}_About Kimonos.ogg
|vo_01_35_tx         = '''{name3}:''' *sigh* [[Ogura Mio]] says that she hardly has any fancy kimonos in stock these days. So, chances are that you won't be able to buy one, even if you can afford it.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' It's a real tragedy... Paimon wants to look glamorous, too.<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' But the Sakoku Decree's been abolished... She should be able to import silk from Liyue now.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' *gasp* You're right! Great, so there's hope for Paimon's kimono-dream after all!<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Just imagine it... Paimon emerges from Ogura's shop wearing a custom-made pure-silk one-of-a-kind kimono. Total transformation! This Paimon's going places!<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' No longer just a sidekick in the legendary Traveler's adventure story... Oh no, say hello to Paimon the Elegant, wearer of fine silks and fated friend of heroes!<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Ahhh... Wouldn't that be amazing?<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' ...It would, wouldn't it, ({name})? Um, so—<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' What I'm hearing is... you want me to pay for your new wardrobe.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Exactly, you read Paimon's mind! See, that's what being "fated friends" is all about!<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Um, so Paimon was thinking seven different styles, one for each day of the week. Still not sure on the specific designs though, let Paimon think...<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' ...Uh, suddenly, I'm not so interested in buying.
|vo_01_35_mention    = Ogura Mio
}}

===Sumeru===
{{VO/Traveler
|vo_01_01_title      = About [[Canned Knowledge]]
|vo_01_01_quest      = The Morn a Thousand Roses Brings
|vo_01_01_file_male  = VO_{language}{character1}_About Canned Knowledge.ogg
|vo_01_01_file_female= VO_{language}{character2}_About Canned Knowledge.ogg
|vo_01_01_tx         = '''{name3}:''' Free knowledge without having to study at all? Canned Knowledge is amazing!<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Could Sumeru have Canned Knowledge about the different customs of the seven nations, too?<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' If so, Paimon could just open a can every time we get to a new place. Paimon wouldn't have to explain things ever again!<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Or we could just open them all here in Sumeru.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' But... but traveling wouldn't be any fun without surprises to look forward to!<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' {{MC|Ooh, plus|Plus|mc=1}}, if we opened them all here, I wouldn't even need Paimon as a guide anymore.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Okay scrap that idea! No more Canned Knowledge, let's save our Mora for something else!<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Something like... Oh! Tipping Paimon for guide services! Heehee, seems fair, right?
|vo_01_01_mention    = Paimon

|vo_01_02_title      = About [[The Eremites]]
|vo_01_02_quest      = The Morn a Thousand Roses Brings
|vo_01_02_file_male  = VO_{language}{character1}_About The Eremites.ogg
|vo_01_02_file_female= VO_{language}{character2}_About The Eremites.ogg
|vo_01_02_tx         = '''{name3}:''' The Eremites are a real motley crew...<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' There's certainly a diverse range of characters.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Hmmm... yeah, that could explain it! Paimon can play lots of different characters too.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Judgy Paimon, knowledgeable Paimon, helpful Paimon...<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' ...And of course the classic, completely-misses-the-point Paimon.

|vo_01_03_title      = About Beliefs
|vo_01_03_quest      = The Morn a Thousand Roses Brings
|vo_01_03_hidden     = A Toast to Victory
|vo_01_03_file_male  = VO_{language}{character1}_About Beliefs.ogg
|vo_01_03_file_female= VO_{language}{character2}_About Beliefs.ogg
|vo_01_03_tx         = '''{name3}:''' Have you noticed something? People in Sumeru don't seem to have a lot of faith in Lesser Lord Kusanali.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Back in Liyue and Inazuma, people were pretty enthusiastic about Rex Lapis and the Almighty Shogun.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Those strange scholars are one thing, but even everyone living downtown only ever seems to talk about Greater Lord Rukkhadevata.<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Yeah. {{MC|And|That's true... Even|mc=1}} the most delicious mushrooms are said to be Greater Lord Rukkhadevata's blessing.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Speaking of which, lots of the dishes in Liyue are said to have been taught and approved by Rex Lapis himself...<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Aha! So as long as a god blesses their people with delicious food, people will worship them!<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Hehe, if their name is Paimon, sure.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Huh? Wait, so... ({name}), what do you believe in, then?<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Me? Hmm... Paimon, of course.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Heehee, that's right!
|vo_01_03_mention    = Lesser Lord Kusanali,Morax,Raiden Shogun,Greater Lord Rukkhadevata,Paimon

|vo_01_04_title      = About the [[Wall of Samiel]]
|vo_01_04_quest      = The Morn a Thousand Roses Brings
|vo_01_04_file_male  = VO_{language}{character1}_About the Wall of Samiel.ogg
|vo_01_04_file_female= VO_{language}{character2}_About the Wall of Samiel.ogg
|vo_01_04_tx         = '''{name3}:''' The first time we saw the Wall of Samiel, Paimon was stunned... It seems to go on forever.<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Well, it was built to protect the entire rainforest, after all.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' And, it's so, so tall...<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Who knows if ({name})'ll be able to climb all the way to the top.<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' I doubt it...? Also, why do I have to climb it, exactly?<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Uh... because it's right there?<ref group="Note">Refers to the famous quote of mountaineer {{W|George Mallory}} "Because it's there" when asked about why he wanted to climb Mount Everest.</ref><br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Hmm, even so... No.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' The Wall of Samiel is right there in front of us!<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' I know, I know, but it's way too&mdash;<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' But it's the Wall of Samiel...<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Fine! I'll go, okay?

|vo_01_05_title      = About [[Akasha Terminal]]s
|vo_01_05_quest      = The Morn a Thousand Roses Brings
|vo_01_05_file_male  = VO_{language}{character1}_About Akasha Terminals.ogg
|vo_01_05_file_female= VO_{language}{character2}_About Akasha Terminals.ogg
|vo_01_05_tx         = '''{name3}:''' All these Sumeru scholars seem to wear Akasha Terminals so they can get information from the Akasha system.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' It's like they're carrying an interactive encyclopedia with them wherever they go. Paimon's kinda jealous.<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Well, I'm not jealous. I have an even better encyclopedia that automatically follows me around, gives me the A-to-Z on everything in Teyvat, and the best part is, it can even talk!<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Huh? Was that a compliment? Aw, you're making Paimon blush... Paimon definitely doesn't know as much as an encyclopedia! A-to-Y at most.<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Well, you know... maybe if you ate a little less, you'd have room for Z, too.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Hey!!!
|vo_01_05_mention    = Paimon

|vo_01_06_title      = About [[Aranara]] Names
|vo_01_06_quest      = ???
|vo_01_06_file_male  = VO_{language}{character1} About Aranara Names.ogg
|vo_01_06_file_female= VO_{language}{character2} About Aranara Names.ogg
|vo_01_06_tx         = '''{name3}:''' Arama, Arana, Araja, Arakavi... Whew, Aranara names are so hard to remember...<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' The only bit Paimon's sure of is that they all start with "Ara"!<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Right, so if you were an Aranara, your name would be "Arapaimon."<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Yup, and as for (Traveler)...<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Hmm, actually, they'd probably call you Nara (Traveler)...<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Yeah, we're all Nara to them...<br /><!--
                    --> '''{name3}:''' So if there was someone whose actual name was "Nara," what would the Aranara call them?<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' "Nara Nara"... I guess. Sounds kinda cute.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Hehe, yeah.
|vo_01_06_mention    = Arama,Arana,Araja,Arakavi

|vo_01_07_title      = About Aranara Cuisine
|vo_01_07_quest      = ???
|vo_01_07_file_male  = VO_{language}{character1} About Aranara Cuisine.ogg
|vo_01_07_file_female= VO_{language}{character2} About Aranara Cuisine.ogg
|vo_01_07_tx         = '''{name3}:''' For some reason, the Aranara's food all tasted a little too... um, how to put this... a little too "fresh."<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' It's totally different from what we usually eat.<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Yeah, but their ingredients are top-quality.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Yeah, that's true. Still, those mushrooms and fruits were so raw, it felt like they were gonna keep growing in Paimon's stomach!<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Heh, you're exaggerating, right? You do have a point, though &mdash; maybe the best ingredients don't need a lot of fancy cooking.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' You're right. If the ingredients are good enough, they'll taste great even when cooked with the simplest methods.<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Just like Paimon. Just a little salt and pepper, and&mdash;<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Hey! For crying out loud, we're in Sumeru now! Don't you think that joke's getting a little old?

|vo_01_08_title      = About [[Dori]]'s Genie
|vo_01_08_quest      = A Teapot to Call Home: Part I
|vo_01_08_file_male  = VO_{language}{character1} About Dori's Genie.ogg
|vo_01_08_file_female= VO_{language}{character2} About Dori's Genie.ogg
|vo_01_08_tx         = '''{name3}:''' How did a genie that big get into Dori's lamp?<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' {{MC|Only|There's only|mc=1}} one way to find out: In you go, Paimon.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Not a chance! There's no way Paimon would fit in there!<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Okay, well... if you want, you can be the genie of the Serenitea Pot instead?<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Oooh, great idea! Paimon's down!<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' You seem pretty excited about this...<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Uh, yeah! Paimon's been wanting to try this for ages! ...Poof! Didst thou summon me, O Traveler from a distant land?<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Come on, come on, now you have to grant Paimon three wishes! Paimon's first wish is... bring Paimon lots of delicious food!<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' {{MC|Hey|Paimon|mc=1}}, you're not supposed to be the one making wishes!
|vo_01_08_mention    = Dori

|vo_01_09_title      = About [[Bimarstan]]
|vo_01_09_waypoint   = in [[Sumeru City]], [[Sumeru]]
|vo_01_09_file_male  = VO_{language}{character1} About Bimarstan.ogg
|vo_01_09_file_female= VO_{language}{character2} About Bimarstan.ogg
|vo_01_09_tx         = '''{name3}:''' Whoa, healthcare is FREE in Sumeru?<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Are you feeling unwell, Paimon?<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' No, not right now. Thanks for asking, though.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Hehe... Eating the street food on every corner has never sounded so tempting!<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' {{MC|Hehe, your stomach|Your stomach|mc=1}} is gonna punish you for that!<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' If so, Paimon'll go see a doctor and get treated &mdash; it's all for free! It'd be a waste not to take advantage of this, don't you think?<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Maybe... but then again, the treatment would likely include a restricted diet.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' *gasp* Oh no! So no more delicious food, then?<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' That, plus the doctor would make you take the most bitter-tasting medicine ever.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' O&mdash;Okay... Maybe Paimon needs to reconsider this idea...

|vo_01_10_title      = About the Scholars
|vo_01_10_waypoint   = in [[Sumeru City]], [[Sumeru]]
|vo_01_10_file_male  = VO_{language}{character1} About the Scholars.ogg
|vo_01_10_file_female= VO_{language}{character2} About the Scholars.ogg
|vo_01_10_tx         = '''{name3}:''' So many people in Sumeru want to become scholars.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Motivated by this ambition, they all study really hard to try and achieve it...<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' But Paimon bets that the first ever scholar didn't set out to become a scholar...<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Hmm... so what do you think the first ever scholar's ambition was?<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Probably... to get their research paper written as quickly as possible.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Huh? But isn't a scholar's ultimate goal supposed to be "pursuing the highest and greatest knowledge" or something?<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Paimon's sure that it must have been because of a fervent desire for knowledge that they became Sumeru's first true scholar.<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Writing papers is how you pursue knowledge.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' But what about when it's the highest and greatest knowledge of all...<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Even then, if you wanted to prove it, you'd need a research paper.<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' And after that, you'd need to start working on another paper to validate your original thesis...<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' O&mdash;Okay, Paimon's got it! Come on, don't look so sad! It's not like you have to worry about writing papers yourself!<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' ...Y&mdash;You've never had to write a paper before, right...?

|vo_01_11_title      = About [[Amurta]]
|vo_01_11_waypoint   = in [[Sumeru City]], [[Sumeru]]
|vo_01_11_file_male  = VO_{language}{character1} About Amurta.ogg
|vo_01_11_file_female= VO_{language}{character2} About Amurta.ogg
|vo_01_11_tx         = '''{name3}:''' Paimon wants to go visit the Amurta scholars!<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' {{MC|Hehe, when|When|mc=1}} did you become such an avid student, Paimon?<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Well, Paimon heard that the Amurta scholars' research is all about nature.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Which means... they must have to research which animals are edible, and which ones taste the best, and... y'know that kind of thing!<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Paimon thinks it'd be really fun to help them out with their research.<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' In other words, you've got a craving for some tasty, organic dishes.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' No! Paimon genuinely thinks that it's a really meaningful research topic and wants to help out!<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Hmm, well in that case... I think the Amurta scholars might be more interested to find out about Paimon's species and behavioral patterns.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Uh... Gee is that the time? Paimon just remembered we have something else more important to do!

|vo_01_12_title      = About [[Sumpter Beast]]s
|vo_01_12_waypoint   = in [[Sumeru City]], [[Sumeru]]
|vo_01_12_file_male  = VO_{language}{character1} About Sumpter Beasts.ogg
|vo_01_12_file_female= VO_{language}{character2} About Sumpter Beasts.ogg
|vo_01_12_tx         = '''{name3}:''' Sumpter Beasts are adorable! Paimon likes how the people who keep them give them each a special name based on their most distinctive traits!<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' For all we know, the Sumpter Beasts might be giving each of us a name in return. Maybe that's how they respond when we call their name.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Really? So what kind of name do think they'd give us?<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' (Sumpter Beast noises)<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' How is anyone supposed to understand that!<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' A rough translation would be...<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' "Vociferous Pestiferous Melliculus Niveous Micro-Bipedal."<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' That's the scientific name, of course.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Oh? What would the common name be then?<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' "Noisy Two-Legged Critter"<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Hey! Why keep only the negative traits?

|vo_01_13_title      = About the Seventh [[Darshan]]
|vo_01_13_waypoint   = in [[Sumeru City]], [[Sumeru]]
|vo_01_13_file_male  = VO_{language}{character1} About the Seventh Darshan.ogg
|vo_01_13_file_female= VO_{language}{character2} About the Seventh Darshan.ogg
|vo_01_13_tx         = '''{name3}:''' There are six Darshans in Sumeru.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' It would be cool if Paimon had her own Darshan too!<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' It'll be called... Paimonology!<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' {{MC|What|And... what|mc=1}} wisdom would Paimonology stand for?<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Uh... practical wisdom for everyday life!<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' So Paimonology scholars would specialize in the art of cooking slimes in a hundred different ways, never letting a single Mora escape their grasp, giving people ugly nicknames... et cetera?<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Whoa, you read Paimon's mind! Also, don't forget "How to Become the Best Travel Guide in Teyvat"!<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' This is a fantastic idea! Come on, let's go submit a Darshan application to the Akademiya! From this day on, ({name})'ll be the Grand Sage of Paimonology!<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' I'd like to decline the honor, please...

|vo_01_14_title      = About [[Shroomboar]]s
|vo_01_14_waypoint   = in [[Sumeru City]], [[Sumeru]]
|vo_01_14_file_male  = VO_{language}{character1} About Shroomboars.ogg
|vo_01_14_file_female= VO_{language}{character2} About Shroomboars.ogg
|vo_01_14_tx         = '''{name3}:''' Did you know that there are all kinds of strange Shroom-Kin in Sumeru?<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' {{MC|Oh, yeah|Yup|mc=1}}. Here's a fun one &mdash; legend has it that there were some forest boars who couldn't live without mushrooms, and the two species gradually formed a symbiotic relationship with each other. Now they're known as "Shroomboars."<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Woah, that's a lot like us! Paimon can't live without ({name}) either.<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' If you can't live without me, that means... I'm the shroom, and Paimon's the...<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Boar!<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Hey, wait a second...

|vo_01_15_title      = About the [[Grand Bazaar]]
|vo_01_15_waypoint   = in [[Sumeru City]], [[Sumeru]]
|vo_01_15_file_male  = VO_{language}{character1} About the Grand Bazaar.ogg
|vo_01_15_file_female= VO_{language}{character2} About the Grand Bazaar.ogg
|vo_01_15_tx         = '''{name3}:''' The residents of the Grand Bazaar are all so talented!<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' They sell their own woven goods, beautiful vases and jars, and delicious-smelling spices that make Paimon's tummy start rumbling...<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' And they all sing and dance really well! Paimon wishes she could do that.<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Well, if you're serious about it, there's no reason you couldn't learn.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' What? Really?？<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Well for starters, you have a natural advantage when it comes to dancing.<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' You won't trip over yourself, or accidentally step on {{MC|someone else's|someone's|mc=1}} foot...<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Oh yeah! Paimon always forgets how useful flying can be!<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Alright then! Let's go bust a move at the Grand Bazaar and watch everyone shower Paimon with admiration!<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Aha, so that's what this is all about.

|vo_01_16_title      = About Divination
|vo_01_16_waypoint   = in [[Sumeru City]], [[Sumeru]]
|vo_01_16_file_male  = VO_{language}{character1} About Divination.ogg
|vo_01_16_file_female= VO_{language}{character2} About Divination.ogg
|vo_01_16_tx         = '''{name3}:''' People in Sumeru seem to take divination and fortune-telling pretty seriously.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' For starters, there's astrology, although only the scholars get to practice that. But ordinary citizens have their ways, too. They can do divinations with just a cup of coffee!<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' It's the nation of wisdom after all. It seems like people have an insatiable curiosity to learn about everything, including their own future.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Paimon heard that they can tell your fate just by looking at the bottom of a finished cup of coffee...<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Sounds way easier than climbing to the top of a tower and staring at the stars all night!<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Oh, so you're interested in learning your fate now?<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Yeah... although, Paimon's really more interested in finding out what the coffee tastes like.

|vo_01_17_title      = About Purbiruni and [[Pursina]]
|vo_01_17_waypoint   = in [[Sumeru City]], [[Sumeru]]
|vo_01_17_file_male  = VO_{language}{character1} About Purbiruni and Pursina.ogg
|vo_01_17_file_female= VO_{language}{character2} About Purbiruni and Pursina.ogg
|vo_01_17_tx         = '''{name3}:''' [[Khedive]] and [[Anisa]] kept talking about "Purbiruni" this and "Pursina" that...<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Why do all these words have "pur" at the front?<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' {{MC|Well, "Pur"|"Pur"|mc=1}} means "descendant," and also "student"... So in this case, they're referring to themselves as the children and students of the great sages of old.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Huh, so that's what it means... From the way they were throwing these words around, Paimon was sure it'd be something to be proud of.<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Wait... But isn't it?<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Well, Paimon for one would much rather be known as the founding father than have a name that basically says "So-and-so's my daddy." Pretty embarrassing, don't you think?<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Um... I have to admit, I've never thought about it like that...
|vo_01_17_mention    = Khedive,Anisa,Pursina

|vo_01_18_title      = About Studying Abroad
|vo_01_18_waypoint   = in [[Sumeru City]], [[Sumeru]]
|vo_01_18_file_male  = VO_{language}{character1} About Studying Abroad.ogg
|vo_01_18_file_female= VO_{language}{character2} About Studying Abroad.ogg
|vo_01_18_tx         = '''{name3}:''' It's not only Sumeru locals at the Akademiya, huh. There are students from other nations too.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Imagine leaving your hometown behind and traveling to a faraway and unfamiliar land in the pursuit of learning... How inspiring!<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' We travel to unfamiliar lands pretty often, too.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Huh, you're right! That means we're also super inspiring!<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Not in the pursuit of learning, though.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Oh... So we're not as inspiring as the students after all...<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Buuut we do know the best places to eat in Sumeru, and who you can rely on to help you out! That counts as knowledge, right?<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Yeah, and to many people, it could be extremely valuable knowledge.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Great, so we're just as inspiring as them after all!

|vo_01_19_title      = About the [[Divine Tree]]
|vo_01_19_waypoint   = in [[Sumeru City]], [[Sumeru]] and in [[Inazuma City]], [[Inazuma]]
|vo_01_19_statue     = ({{Anemo}}) in [[Windrise]], [[Mondstadt]] and Statue of the Seven ({{Anemo}}) in [[Entombed City - Ancient Palace]], [[Mondstadt]]
|vo_01_19_file_male  = VO_{language}{character1} About the Divine Tree.ogg
|vo_01_19_file_female= VO_{language}{character2} About the Divine Tree.ogg
|vo_01_19_tx         = '''{name3}:''' The whole of Sumeru City is built on top of a giant tree. How amazing is that!<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' We've seen lots of incredible trees on our journey, haven't we? There's our old stomping ground at Windrise, the Frostbearing Tree on Dragonspine, and the Sacred Sakura in Inazuma!<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Sumeru's tree doesn't seem to have a fancy name though. People just call it "the Divine Tree"...<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Sometimes, the most important things have the simplest names.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Really? Hmm, maybe you have a point. Long names would be kinda inconvenient if you had to say them every day.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Anyway, people in the city only have to say "down below" and everyone knows they mean the bottom of the tree.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' What's that saying again? "Names aren't things themselves, they're just words for things."<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' So is Paimon just a word for a thing, too?<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Yeah. Well, uh, kinda. But... wait, no! No, Paimon is just Paimon!

|vo_01_20_title      = About Inter-Darshan Relations
|vo_01_20_waypoint   = in [[Sumeru City]], [[Sumeru]] and in [[Liyue Harbor]], [[Liyue]]
|vo_01_20_file_male  = VO_{language}{character1} About Inter-Darshan Relations.ogg
|vo_01_20_file_female= VO_{language}{character2} About Inter-Darshan Relations.ogg
|vo_01_20_tx         = '''{name3}:''' So, with Sumeru having so many scholars in different Darshans, do you think they end up arguing a lot?<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' You know, just like the rivalry between Li cuisine and Yue cuisine in Liyue.<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' I'm sure they do. Conflict between different schools of thought is the most normal thing ever. As the Liyue martial arts novels say: "Wherever there are people, there will be conflict."<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Wow, what a line. That's heavy... But the scholars in Sumeru probably don't duel like Liyue martial artists, right?<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Maybe they settle things with a game of Genius Invokation TCG.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Ohh, good point! A duel of wits!<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Paimon can just imagine it: When one scholar can't convince another in an argument, he takes out his deck of cards, calmly sits down opposite his opponent, thinks for a moment, and then secures his victory!<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' That does sound like something that would happen in Sumeru.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' The game ends, and the winner says "good game" as a sign of respect to his opponent. After that, both sides are back on good terms.<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' {{MC|Um... saying that would probably only escalate the conflict|Umm, not necessarily...|mc=1}}.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Huh? Why?

|vo_01_21_title      = About [[Port Ormos]]
|vo_01_21_waypoint   = in [[Port Ormos]], [[Sumeru]]
|vo_01_21_file_male  = VO_{language}{character1} About Port Ormos.ogg
|vo_01_21_file_female= VO_{language}{character2} About Port Ormos.ogg
|vo_01_21_tx         = '''{name3}:''' Whew, Port Ormos definitely has a different vibe to Sumeru City...<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' It's a bustling area, and there's so many outlanders. Plus, no one needs to spend all their time buried in their studies, which is nice.<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Yes, but that's why they end up being disciplined by the port authorities. So you see, Paimon? If you don't study hard, you'll end up just like them!<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Oh...<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Wait! What was that tone of voice for!?

|vo_01_22_title      = About the Alliance of the Twenty-Nine Ocean Deys
|vo_01_22_waypoint   = in [[Port Ormos]], [[Sumeru]]
|vo_01_22_file_male  = VO_{language}{character1} About the Alliance of the Twenty-Nine Ocean Deys.ogg
|vo_01_22_file_female= VO_{language}{character2} About the Alliance of the Twenty-Nine Ocean Deys.ogg
|vo_01_22_tx         = '''{name3}:''' Port Ormos is built on the ruins of the fortress of The Alliance of the... the... the alliance of something, anyway.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Ugh, the name's too long, Paimon can't remember it! Anyway, that's what all the bookish people in Sumeru say.<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Oh, you mean "The Alliance of the Twenty-Nine Ocean Deys"?<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Apparently, the alliance was formed by a bunch of arrogant pirate leaders, none of whom wanted to work for any of the others. They fought and looted each other constantly, causing endless chaos in coastal Sumeru...<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Finally, one day, they decided to enter into an alliance with one another and divide power equally between themselves. The members of the alliance were called "Deys"...<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Oh... And so after that... there was no more fighting and no more stealing, so everyone could get along happily and make a boatload of Mora together! Right?<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' ...<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Right...?<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Well... presumably that's what they were hoping...<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Huh...?<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Before long, they were forming factions again, and the infighting between them escalated into the biggest internal battle they'd seen yet. Their fortress at Port Ormos was completely destroyed, and all the Deys were done for!<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Whaaat?<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Following that, an unprecedented period of peace finally came to Port Ormos, and the area began to develop into what we see today...<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Huh... So the Alliance was just a bunch of dumb bad guys...

|vo_01_23_title      = About [[Cyno]] and Genius Invokation TCG...
|vo_01_23_waypoint   = in [[Sumeru City]], [[Sumeru]]
|vo_01_23_file_male  = VO_{language}{character1} About Cyno and Genius Invokation TCG.ogg
|vo_01_23_file_female= VO_{language}{character2} About Cyno and Genius Invokation TCG.ogg
|vo_01_23_tx         = '''{name3}:''' Cyno's super into that card game "Genius Invokation TCG," isn't he?<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Doesn't it seem kinda weird for the General Mahamatra to be into playing cards...?<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Hmm... not when you consider his hairstyle.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Huh? What has his hairstyle got to do with it?<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' When you're playing a card game, the fancier your hairstyle, the more distracting it is for your opponent.<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' "What's going on with this guy? How did he manage to shape his hair like that?"<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' When your opponent's mind is consumed with thoughts like this, you'll quickly gain the upper hand.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Hmm, really? Then we'd better think twice before playing against him...<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' I don't know... I think I might just have an advantage over him.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' But you don't have a fancy hairstyle at all. And your clothes look pretty normal too...<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' But I do have Paimon.<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' You know, he'd be like: "What's up with this guy? And what's that pesky flying companion of his up to?"<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' As long as you're floating by my side, Cyno's mind will be consumed with thoughts like this.<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' I, on the other hand, would be completely unfazed by his hairstyle. So I'd be able to focus, and victory would be mine.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Forget it! If you wanna play cards, go get a funny haircut!

|vo_01_24_title      = About Sumeru Nursery Rhymes...
|vo_01_24_quest      = ???
|vo_01_24_file_male  = VO_{language}{character1} About Sumeru Nursery Rhymes.ogg
|vo_01_24_file_female= VO_{language}{character2} About Sumeru Nursery Rhymes.ogg
|vo_01_24_tx         = '''{name3}:''' ♪ Curry, curry, in the air~ Hungry children it's time to come home~ ♪<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' ♪ Curry, curry, in the air~ ♪<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Wow! Good job, so you remember the tune as well!<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Good job to you too, Paimon. You sing really well.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Heehee, that's because Paimon's got a great plan!<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Have you heard this story? Once upon a time, there was a hilihound who was given meat to eat whenever the samachurls started dancing. Eventually, the hilihound started drooling whenever it heard the sound of dancing.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Whenever we hear the curry song, we get curry to eat. So, all Paimon has to do is learn the song by heart, and then in the future, whenever Paimon is craving a big bowl of tasty curry, all she has to do is sing it!<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Hey, aren't you gonna say something?<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' ♪ Curry, curry, in the air~ Hungry children it's time to come home~ ♪

|vo_01_25_title      = About Aranara Tongue Twisters...
|vo_01_25_quest      = ???
|vo_01_25_file_male  = VO_{language}{character1} About Aranara Tongue Twisters.ogg
|vo_01_25_file_female= VO_{language}{character2} About Aranara Tongue Twisters.ogg
|vo_01_25_tx         = '''({name}):''' Paimon, do you ever find that the word "Aranara" trips you up?<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Hmm? Why, does it trip you up? Maybe that's because you don't really say anything most of the time.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Unlike Paimon! Paimon has to talk all the time, so she never gets stuck on words.<br /><!--
                    -->'''({name}):''' Okay, well, try reading this then.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' What is it? Let's see here...<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Arana the Aranara exercises Ararakalari in the nearby area.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Narana the Nara picks Padisarahs in a parallel area further afield.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Narana the Padisarah-picking Nara had arranged to invite Arana the Aranara to the bar to befriend Lambad, but alas, Arana the Ararakalari-exercising Aranara professed a preference to Padisarah-picking Nara, Narana, for venturing to Vanarana to view the panorama.<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' On account of Arana the Aranara's antipathy to bar drama, Narana the Nara relented and, upon accompanying the latter on a Vanarana-panorama adventure, encountered another Aranara, named "Arama."<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' This must be one of those really weird dreams, right...<br /><!--
                    -->'''{name3}:''' Ugh, but this headache feels pretty real...

}}
